intro: Thlaspi perfoliatum subsp. neglectum, commonly known as the bladder campion, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that often have a bladdery appearance, and it produces small, white or pink flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky or disturbed soils, often growing in alpine or arctic regions. It is a perennial herb that thrives in cold climates and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Its subspecies neglectum is distinguished by its more robust growth and slightly different leaf morphology compared to the typical form.
